main event: On September 24, 1956, in Jackson, Mississippi, a civilian reported sighting four to six band-shaped and elongated objects. The objects were metallic silver and were widely spaced in a straight line. They gradually vanished into the sky without maneuvering.
interesting points: The sighting lasted only 10-15 seconds, providing limited data for evaluation.
The objects were described as band-shaped and elongated, which is unusual for conventional aircraft or natural phenomena.
The objects were widely spaced and held the same relative position to each other, indicating a coordinated movement.
The objects gradually changed from shining silver to grey before vanishing, suggesting a unique capability.
The report was inconclusive, with the USAF stating insufficient data for evaluation.
sighted object: Four to six band-shaped and elongated metallic silver objects
